An **amulet of magical breathing** is a type of [amulet](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 Identification](#Identification)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)

## Generation

The amulet of magical breathing makes up 6.5% of all randomly-generated amulets.

## Description

While worn, the amulet of magical breathing grants extrinsic [breathlessness](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless"), making the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") [amphibious](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious"): This allows them to breathe while underwater and prevents them from [drowning](/wiki/Drowning "Drowning") by any means, though their inventory will be subject to [water damage](/wiki/Wet "Wet") as usual. Water squares are also considered "safe" for purposes of [teleportation](/wiki/Teleportation "Teleportation"). The 1000 [experience point](/wiki/Experience_point "Experience point")-bonus for killing [sea monsters](/wiki/Sea_monster "Sea monster") with drowning attacks does not apply while the hero is amphibious from wearing the amulet.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

A hero wearing the amulet is also protected from the effects of [sleeping gas traps](/wiki/Sleeping_gas_trap "Sleeping gas trap") and the [engulfing](/wiki/Engulf "Engulf") attacks of [fog clouds](/wiki/Fog_cloud "Fog cloud");[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) [poison clouds](/wiki/Poison_cloud "Poison cloud") will not damage them regardless of [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") and are not considered a major [trouble](/wiki/Trouble "Trouble") for [prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer"), though they can still [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind") the hero.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

Breathlessness from the amulet also protects the hero from choking to death via either the effect of eating an [amulet of strangulation](/wiki/Amulet_of_strangulation "Amulet of strangulation") or [eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") too much food while breathless from the amulet - in the latter case, they will always "vomit voluminously" instead and lose 1000 [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition"), abusing [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution").[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

[Eating](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry") the amulet has a 1⁄5 chance of granting intrinsic breathlessness. Monsters will not wear this amulet.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 24713061](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/24713061124282731c2d16d3d8ebecc57d906233), walking into poison clouds while wearing the amulet will identify it.

## Strategy

The amulet of magical breathing can be a form of protection from drowning, making fighting sea monsters less dangerous and enabling a character to cross large bodies of water, but the amount of items that are susceptible to [rust](/wiki/Rust "Rust"), [dilution](/wiki/Dilution "Dilution") and [blanking](/wiki/Blanking "Blanking") can reasonably put players off the notion. An [oilskin sack](/wiki/Oilskin_sack "Oilskin sack") to place those valuables in (or a [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding") containing such valuables) can make the idea of "swimming" this way much more tenable. Some players also elect to [polyself](/wiki/Polyself "Polyself") into a [metallivore](/wiki/Metallivore "Metallivore") and eat multiple amulets until they gain the intrinsic, keeping their amulet slot free for other options - keep in mind that this carries the same risk described above.

Magical breathing can be used to retrieve items dropped by monsters that are killed over a body of water, as well as [projectiles](/wiki/Projectile "Projectile") fired at such monsters - depending on your circumstances, it may be preferable to use a [wand of teleportation](/wiki/Wand_of_teleportation "Wand of teleportation") for heavier items, or [apply](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a [bullwhip](/wiki/Bullwhip "Bullwhip") while [levitating](/wiki/Levitating "Levitating") for lighter items.

An amulet of magical breathing can help you chew through several [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") such as those of [giants](/wiki/Giant_\(monster_attribute\) "Giant (monster attribute)") and [dragons](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon") without fear of choking, and can also help with [troll](/wiki/Troll_\(monster_class\) "Troll (monster class)") disposal by eating in a few cases - the act of eating multiple large corpses is still time-consuming, however, and they may become tainted before you can finish enough of them; constant over-satiation also abuses [dexterity](/wiki/Dexterity "Dexterity"), though this is a relatively lesser concern. A [tinning kit](/wiki/Tinning_kit "Tinning kit") is more ideal in most cases if you have one, both to deal with large corpses and reviving ones.

The best use case for the amulet of magical breathing is on the [Plane of Water](/wiki/Plane_of_Water "Plane of Water"), where the water prevents the use of [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation") and [water walking boots](/wiki/Water_walking_boots "Water walking boots") - magical breathing makes travel between the air bubbles trivial, with the only related difficulty being water currents and the aforementioned damage to items. Players will often use a spare [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") on an oilskin sack to avoid this if they have not found one already. While [polyself](/wiki/Polyself "Polyself") into a breathless or swimming form can also provide a means of traveling between air bubbles, it is quite dangerous: the form may time out unexpectedly, or you may be prematurely returned to normal from HP damage (typically from the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor")).

### Identification

This amulet can be identified by falling into water: if you don't attempt to crawl out, the amulet must be magical breathing. If testing for the amulet, make sure that you are not [fumbling](/wiki/Fumbling "Fumbling") and have accessible land squares nearby (e.g. not occupied by monsters or [boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder")), and drop any items that are [greased](/wiki/Grease "Grease") or vulnerable to water damage.

A fog cloud can also be used to test for the amulet, since breathlessness negates the meager physical damage from its engulfing attack and produces a distinct message.

## History

The amulet of magic breathing first appears in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0").

## Messages

- *Main article: [Breathless#Messages](/wiki/Breathless#Messages "Breathless")*

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), a well-hidden chest in the northwestern corner of [Grund's Stronghold](/wiki/Grund%27s_Stronghold "Grund's Stronghold") has a 1⁄3 chance of containing a amulet of magical breathing - the amulet is always accompanied by a [spellbook of haste self](/wiki/Spellbook_of_haste_self "Spellbook of haste self").

The amulet of magical breathing is one of many methods that can be employed to survive [create pool](/wiki/Create_pool "Create pool") [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell"), though a hero's inventory will still be subjected to water damage.

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), [gelatinous cubes](/wiki/Gelatinous_cube "Gelatinous cube") and [water elementals](/wiki/Water_elemental "Water elemental") are capable of causing [strangulation](/wiki/Strangulation "Strangulation") via [engulfing](/wiki/Engulf "Engulf") - cubes can still paralyze the hero as well, making the amulet of magical breathing far more valuable early on as a means of surviving cube encounters.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [The Sea](/wiki/The_Sea_\(dNetHack\) "The Sea (dNetHack)") contains a guaranteed amulet of magical breathing on each map in the event that the level's guaranteed [magic lamp](/wiki/Magic_lamp "Magic lamp") is placed underwater.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), gelatinous cubes and water elementals behave mostly the same as they do in GruntHack, making the amulet of magical breathing valuable to identify early. [Sea dragons](/index.php?title=Sea_dragon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sea dragon (page does not exist)") also have an engulfing attack that can suffocate characters, and [green slimes](/wiki/Green_slime "Green slime") can inflict sliming while suffocating an engulfed victim.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), only the sea dragon and green slime retain their ability to suffocate characters from EvilHack, making the amulet of magical breathing less necessary early on.
